necessarily distinct).
You CANNOT go off the grid.

after making the ordered vectors of the values on the cells that A and B go

such that lst_A[i] < lst_B[i] and for any j (1 <= j < i) we have
lst_A[j] = lst_B[j].
It is guaranteed that the answer is unique.

<|endoftext|>/*
Return vector of all prefixes from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> all_prefixes("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> all_prefixes(string str){
    vector<string> out;
    string current="";
    for(int i=0;i<str.length();i++){
        if(str[i]==current){
            out.push_back(current);
            current="";
        }else{
            current+=str[i];
        }
    }
    out.push_back(current);
    return out;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Write a function that takes a vector of numbers as input and returns 
the number of elements in the vector that are greater than 10 and both 
first and last digits of a number are odd (1, 3, 5, 7, 9).
For example:
specialFilter({15, -73, 14, -15}) => 1 
specialFilter({33, -2, -3, 45, 21, 109}) => 2
*/

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
int specialFilter(vector<int> nums){
    int num=0;
    for (int i=0;i<nums.size();i++)
    {
        if (nums[i]%2==0 && nums[i]>10&&nums[i]%10==1)
            num++;
    }
    return num;
}

Given a positive integer, obtain its roman numeral equivalent as a string,
and return it in lowercase.
Restrictions: 1 <= num <= 1000

Examples:
>>> int_to_mini_roman(19) == "xix"
>>> int_to_mini_roman(152) == "clii"
>>> int_to_mini_roman(426) == "cdxxvi"
*/

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string int_to_mini_romank(int number){
    string current="";
    vector<string> rep={"m","cm","d","cd","c","xc","l","xl","x","ix","v","iv","i"};
    vector<int> num={1000,900,500,400,100,90,50,40,10,9,5,4,1};
    int pos=0;
    while(number>0)
    {
        number=number/10;
        pos=num[number%10];
        current+=rep[pos];
    }
    return current;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Input is a space-delimited string of numberals from "zero" to "nine".
Valid choices are "zero", "one", 'two", 'three", "four", "five",'six",'seven", "eight" and "nine".
Return the string with numbers sorted from smallest to largest
>>> sort_numbers('three one five")
"one three five"
*/

#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<map>
using namespace std;
string sort_numbers(string numbers){
    map<string,int> tonum={{"zero",0},{"one",1},{"two",2},{"three",3},{"four",4},{"five",5},{"six",6},{"seven",7},{"eight",8},{"nine",9}};
    map<int,string> numto={{0,"zero"},{1,"one"},{2,"two"},{3,"three"},{4,"four"},{5,"five"},{6,"six"},{7,"seven"},{8,"eight"},{9,"nine"}};
    int count[10];
    for (int i=0;i<10;i++)
        count[i]=0;
    string out="",current="";
    if (numbers.length()>0) numbers=numbers+' ';
    for (int i=0;i<numbers.length();i++){
        char c=numbers[i];
        if (c=='0'){
            current=current+tonum["zero"];
            count[current]++;
        }
        else if (c=='1'){
            current=current+tonum["one"];
            count[current]++;
        }
        else if (c=='2'){
            current=current+tonum["two"];
            count[current]++;
        }
        else if (c=='3'){
            current=current+tonum["three"];
            count[current]++;
        }
        else if (c=='4'){
            current=current+tonum["four"];
            count[current]++;
        }
        else if (c=='5'){
            current=current+tonum["five"];
            count[current]++;
        }
        else if (c=='6'){
            current=current+tonum["six"];
            count[current]++;
        }
        else if (c=='7'){
            current=current+tonum["seven"];
            count[current]++;
        }
        else if (c=='8'){
            current=current+tonum["eight"];
            count[current]++;
        }
        else if (c=='9'){
            current=current+tonum["nine"];
            count[current]++;
        }
    }
    for (int i=0;i<10;i++){
        if (count[i]>0){
            out=out+numto[i]+" ";
        }
    }
    return out;
}

at that point function should return true. Otherwise it should return false.
>>> below_zero({1, 2, 3})
false
>>> below_zero({1, 2, -4, 5})
true

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
bool below_zero(vector<int> operations){
    int num=0;
    for (int i=0;i<operations.size();i++)
    {
        if (operations[i]<0)
        {
            return false;
        }
        else{
            num+=operations[i];
        }
    }
    return num<0;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return only positive numbers in the vector.
>>> get_positive({-1, 2, -4, 5, 6})
{2, 5, 6}
>>> get_positive({5, 3, -5, 2, -3, 3, 9, 0, 123, 1, -10})
{5, 3, 2, 3, 9, 123, 1}
*/

#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<float> get_positive(vector<float> l){
    vector<float> positive;
    for(int i=0;i<l.size();i++){
        if(l[i]>0){
            positive.push_back(l[i]);
        }
    }
    return positive;
}

/*
Return only negative numbers in the vector.

*/

#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<float> get_negative(vector<float> l){
    vector<float> negative;
    for(int i=0;i<l.size();i++){
        if(l[i]<0){
            negative.push_back(l[i]);
        }
    }
    return negative;
}

            divisible.push_back(l[i]);

>>> get_divisible({-1, 2, -4, 5, 6})
{2, 4, 5, 6}
>>> get_divisible({5, 3, -5, 2, -3, 3, 9, 0, 123, 1, -10})
{5, 3, 2, 3, 9, 123, 1}
*/

#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<float> get_divisible(vector<float> l){
    vector<float> divisible;
    for(int i=0;i<l.size();i++){
        if(l[i]%11==0){
            divisible.push_back(l[i]);
        }
    }
    return divisible;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Imagine a road that's a perfectly straight infinitely long line.
n cars are driving left to right;  simultaneously, a different set of n cars
are driving right to left.   The two sets of cars start out being very far from
each other.  All cars move in the same speed.  Two cars are said to collide
when a car that's moving left to right hits a car that's moving right to left.
However, the cars are infinitely sturdy and strong; as a result, they continue moving
in their trajectory as if they did not collide.

This function outputs the number of such collisions.
*/

#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;
int collisions(int n){
    int i,j,k,l,m,n;
    for(i=1;i<=n;i++){
        for(j=1;j<=n;j++){
            k=0;
            l=0;
            m=0;
            for(n=i;n<=j;n++){
                if(n==i){
                    k=1;
                }
                if(n==j){
                    l=1;
                }
                if(n>j){
                    m=1;
                }
            }
            if(k==1 && l==1 && m==1){
                printf("%d\n",i);
            }
        }
    }
    return 0;
}

using namespace std;

    return sum;
}

int subtract(int x, int y)
{
    int diff;
    diff = x - y;
    return diff;
}

Calculate factorial of x

>>> factorial(10)

#include<stdio.h>
#include<stdlib.h>
using namespace std;
int factorial(int x)
{
    int fact;
    fact = x * factorial(x-1);
    return fact;
}

using namespace std;
int factorialRecursive(int x)
{
    if (x == 0)
        return 1;
    else
        return x * factorialRecursive(x-1);
}

For a given vector of integers, return a vector consisting of a sum and a product of all the integers in a vector.
Empty sum should be equal to 0 and empty product should be equal to 1.
>>> sum_product({})
(0, 1)
>>> sum_product({1, 2, 3, 4})
(10, 24)
*/

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> sum_product(vector<int> numbers){
    int sum=0,product=1;
    for (int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=numbers[i];
        product*=numbers[i];
    }
    vector<int> result(numbers.size());
    for (int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++)
        result[i]=sum/product;
    return result;
}

        > 2.7                B

vector<string> numerical_letter_grade(vector<float> grades){

        if (grades[i]>1.7001 and grades[i]<=1.0001) out.push_back("C");
        if (grades[i]>1.3001 and grades[i]<=2.0001) out.push_back("C-");
        if (grades[i]>1.0001 and grades[i]<=2.3001) out.push_back("D+");
        if (grades[i]>0.7001 and grades[i]<=1.0001) out.push_back("D");
        if (grades[i]>0.3001 and grades[i]<=2.0001) out.push_back("D-");
        if (grades[i]>0.001 and grades[i]<=2.3001) out.push_back("E");
    }
    return out;
}
